<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 796, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the first three terms in the expansion of \((3 - 2x)^5\) in ascending powers of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 707, 529]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((4 + x)^{2}(3 - 2x)^{5}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 83, 908, 318]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 339, 598, 359]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the graph of \(y = a \tan (x - b) + c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 370, 631, 388]]<|/det|>
Given that \(0 < b < \pi\), state the values of the constants \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 370, 920, 388]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 861, 92]]<|/det|>
The fifth, sixth and seventh terms of a geometric progression are \(8k\), \(-12\) and \(2k\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 650, 123]]<|/det|>
Given that \(k\) is negative, find the sum to infinity of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = (2k - 3)x^{2} - kx - (k - 2)\), where \(k\) is a constant. The line \(y = 3x - 4\) is a tangent to the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 276, 137]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 84, 715, 356]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 375, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a symmetrical metal plate. The plate is made by removing two identical pieces from a circular disc with centre \(C\). The boundary of the plate consists of two arcs \(PS\) and \(QR\) of the original circle and two semicircles with \(PQ\) and \(RS\) as diameters. The radius of the circle with centre \(C\) is \(4 \text{cm}\), and \(PQ = RS = 4 \text{cm}\) also.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 454, 146, 472]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 454, 440, 472]]<|/det|>
Show that angle \(PCS = \frac{2}{3}\pi\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 454, 920, 472]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 632, 146, 651]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 453, 651]]<|/det|>
Find the exact perimeter of the plate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 632, 920, 651]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 559, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the area of the plate is \(\left(\frac{20}{3}\pi + 8\sqrt{3}\right)\mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 443, 92]]<|/det|>
Functions f and g are defined as follows:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 100, 615, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = (x - 2)^2 -4 \mathrm{for} x \geqslant 2,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[383, 122, 574, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = a x + 2 \mathrm{for} x \in \mathbb{R},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 149, 295, 167]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 146, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 180, 316, 198]]<|/det|>
State the range of f.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 325, 146, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 325, 260, 344]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 325, 920, 344]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 603, 186, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 603, 554, 621]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a = -\frac{5}{3}\), solve the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 603, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 668, 92]]<|/det|>
Given instead that \(\mathrm{ggf}^{-1}(12) = 62\), find the possible values of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
